1. BUILD & TEST (build.yml)
   Triggers: Push & Pull Requests
   Branches: main, develop, 001-ai-robotics-book-plan
   Node: 20.x
   Tasks:
   - Checkout code
   - Setup Node.js
   - Install dependencies (with npm cache)
   - Run ESLint
   - TypeScript type checking
   - Code formatting check
   - Docusaurus build
   - Upload build artifacts

2. DEPLOY (deploy.yml)
   Triggers: Push to main branch
   Permissions: Pages write access
   Tasks:
   - Checkout code (with full history)
   - Install dependencies
   - Build documentation
   - Setup GitHub Pages
   - Upload artifact
   - Deploy to GitHub Pages

3. CODE QUALITY & SECURITY (quality.yml)
   Triggers: Every push, PRs, Weekly schedule
   Jobs:
   - Security: npm audit
   - Dependency Check: outdated packages
   - Code Quality: ESLint, Prettier, TypeScript

4. DOCUMENTATION (documentation.yml)
   Triggers: Documentation changes
   Tasks:
   - Build docs
   - Validate sidebar structure
   - Check docs directory
   - Count documentation files

STEP 1: Commit and Push
   $ cd /media/awais/New Volume/hackathon
   $ git add .github/
   $ git commit -m "ci: Add GitHub Actions CI/CD workflows"
   $ git push origin 001-ai-robotics-book-plan

STEP 2: Enable GitHub Pages
   1. Go to GitHub Repository Settings
   2. Navigate to Pages section
   3. Set Source to "GitHub Actions"
   4. Save

STEP 3: Monitor Workflows
   1. Visit GitHub Actions tab
   2. See workflows execute automatically
   3. Check status badges
   4. Review logs if needed

STEP 4: Merge to Main (Optional)
   - Create Pull Request
   - Watch build.yml run
   - Merge to main
   - Watch deploy.yml run
   - Verify GitHub Pages deployment
